author: andschwa
body: This enables building PowerShell through VS Code. The build task launches the installed version of PowerShell and runs `Start-PSBuild`. This enables a `launch` debug task to immediately debug the `powershell` process, without having to attach to an external process. Note that it launches the built version of PowerShell as `powershell -c 'exit'`. This should be modified to suit a user's needs. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/powershell/powershell/699)

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I added these as templates, as I'm using it to debug PowerShell startup right now (with new .NET packages).

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I'm not 100% sold on having these as default, since edits will show up as Git modifications. Perhaps they should be moved to `docs/debugging/vscode` along with a more full readme on how to use them. Just putting this up for now; I'd like to reorganize all the documentation with @vors, following a pattern similar to [corefx](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/tree/master/Documentation).
